isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - DISASSEMBLE - REMOVE DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER FROM AXLE HOUSING

svcproc.title: REMOVE DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER FROM AXLE HOUSING

svcprocinfo.para: Before the differential carrier can be removed or installed, the differential lock MUST be shifted into and held in the locked (engaged) position. The locked position gives enough clearance between the shift collar and the axle housing to permit the removal or installation of the carrier.

note.para: If the axle shafts were removed for towing with the differential in the unlocked (disengaged) position, install the right-hand axle shaft into the housing before continuing. Follow steps 1 and 2 of INSTALL AXLE SHAFTS.

svcprocinfo.para: To shift into the locked position, use either of the following Air Pressure or Manual Engaging methods.

step1.para: Remove the drain plug from the bottom of the housing and drain the lubricant.
Raise the right hand wheel of the drive axle off the floor with a hoist or jack.

warning.para: Do not start the vehicle engine and engage the transmission with one wheel raised from the floor. When the differential is in locked (engaged) position, power will go to the wheel on the floor and cause the vehicle to move and possibly cause personal injury.

step1.para: Put a jack stand under the right-hand spring seat to hold the vehicle in the raised position.

warning.para: Do not work under a vehicle supported only by jacks. Jacks can slip or tip over and cause injury.

step1.para: Disconnect the driveline from the pinion input yoke.
Disconnect the vehicle air line from the differential lock actuator assembly.
Connect an auxiliary air supply to the differential lock actuator assembly.

note.para: If an auxiliary air supply is not available, continue to Manual Engaging Method of locking the differential.

step1.para: Apply and hold air pressure to the actuator assembly. The air pressure will move the shift collar to engage with the splines on the differential case half and lock the assembly.

Make sure that the shift collar has moved the full distance on the splines of the differential case half. Rotate the drive pinion or the right-hand wheel until the right-hand wheel makes one complete rotation (forward or backward).
Continue to hold the main differential in the locked position with air pressure until the carrier assembly is completely removed from the axle housing.
Remove the axle shafts from the housing. Follow Steps 1 through 3 of REMOVE AXLE SHAFTS.
Remove the carrier from the housing. Refer to Steps 7 through 14 of Manual Engaging Method.
After the carrier is removed from the axle housing, release the air pressure from the actuator assembly.

svcsubproc.title: Manual Engaging Method
svcsubproc.para: If an auxiliary air supply is not available or if the differential carrier is to be stored for later use, use this manual engaging method ( Figure 5).

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. BOTTOM SIDE STORAGE HOLE FOR PLUG AND GASKET
8. TOP SIDE STORAGE HOLE FOR MANUAL ENGAGING CAPSCREW

step1.para: Follow Steps 1 through 5 of the Air Pressure Method.
Remove the plug and gasket from the hole in the center of the cylinder cover.
Remove the manual engaging capscrew from the top storage hole in the cylinder cover.
Install the plug and gasket into the bottom storage hole in the cylinder cover.

note.para: The storage hole for the plug and gasket is the opposite end of the storage hole for the manual engaging capscrew.

step1.para: Install the manual engaging capscrew into the threaded hole in the center of the cylinder cover.

Turn the manual adjusting capscrew to the right until the head is approximately 1/4 inch from the cylinder cover. DO NOT turn the capscrew beyond its normal stop. The capscrew is now in the service position and the main differential lock is completely engaged.

caution.para: There will be a small amount of spring resistance felt when you turn in the manual engaging capscrew. If a high resistance is felt before reaching the locked (engaged) position, STOP TURNING THE CAPSCREW, or the cover and capscrew threads will be damaged. A high resistance on the capscrew indicates that the splines of the shift collar and the differential case half are not aligned or engaged.

step1.para: To align the splines, use the following procedure:

step2.para: Rotate the drive pinion or right-hand wheel to align the splines of the shift collar and case half while you turn in the manual engaging capscrew.

When the normal amount of spring resistance is again felt on the capscrew, the splines are engaged. Continue to turn in the manual engaging capscrew until the head is approximately 1/4 inch from the cylinder cover.

step1.para: Place a hydraulic roller jack under the differential carrier to support the assembly ( Figure 6).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Place Hydraulic Roller Jack Under Differential Carrier

step1.para: Remove all but the top two carrier-to-housing capscrews or stud nuts and washers.
Loosen the top two carrier-to-housing fasteners and leave attached to the assembly. The fasteners will hold the carrier in the housing.
Loosen the differential carrier in the axle housing. Use a leather mallet to hit the mounting flange of carrier at several points.

note.para: Some carrier models have threaded puller screw holes in the mounting flange. Puller screws can be used to loosen and pull the carrier from the axle housing. If puller screws are used, clean the threaded holes before the puller screws are installed.

step1.para: After the carrier is loosened, remove the top two fasteners.
Carefully remove the carrier from the axle housing using the hydraulic roller jack. Use a pry bar that has a round end to help remove the carrier from the housing.

caution.para: When using a pry bar, be careful not to damage the carrier or housing flange. Damage to these surfaces will cause oil leaks.

step1.para: Remove and discard the carrier-to- housing gasket.

Lift the differential carrier by the input yoke or flange and put the assembly in a repair stand ( Figure 7). Use a lifting tool for this procedure. Do not lift by hand. The repair stand is available through P.D.C. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Put Differential Carrier Assembly in Repair Stand
